text:
<https://www.fastcodesign.com/90133138/googles-next-design-project-artificial-intelligence?utm_content=buffer257e4&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer>

An article version of Google's moves. Especially relevant given lots of our recent work and the work we're being asked to do. Evans has been doing lots lately

attachments.title: Google’s Next Design Project? Artificial Intelligence
attachments.text: “In the early days of graphical user interfaces, people had to invent scroll bars and menus. What is the scroll bar of AI? We don’t know yet.”
attachments.fallback: Co.Design: Google’s Next Design Project? Artificial Intelligence

text:
there have been a few articles covering the same initiative, but their blog post is a great starting point too: <https://www.blog.google/topics/machine-learning/pair-people-ai-research-initiative/>

and from the Google Design blog <https://medium.com/google-design/human-centered-machine-learning-a770d10562cd>

attachments.title: PAIR: the People + AI Research Initiative
attachments.text: The goal of PAIR is to focus on the "human side" of AI: the relationship between users and technology, the new applications it enables, and how to make it broadly inclusive.
attachments.fallback: Google: PAIR: the People + AI Research Initiative

attachments.title: Human-Centered Machine Learning – Google Design – Medium
attachments.text: 7 steps to stay focused on the user when designing with ML
attachments.fallback: Medium: Human-Centered Machine Learning – Google Design – Medium

attachments.title: KFC's iPhone killer has arrived
attachments.text: There are no greater joys in life than gadgets and fried chicken, so why not enjoy them at the same time? KFC gets it: it partnered with Huawei to release a limited edition smartphone to...
attachments.fallback: The Verge: KFC's iPhone killer has arrived
